intro: [WRONG START] Elaeidendron schlechterianum, commonly known as the Schlechter's elaeodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
